name: survivor's .223 magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's .223 assault rifle.  Although well-made, it does not fit STANAG specifications, and still falls short of the real deal in terms of reliablility.

name: survivor's 7.62x39 magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's 7.62x39 assault rifle.  A rough simplfication of the AKM magazine pattern, it's still a bit short of the original's legendary reliability.

name: survivor's .308 magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's .308 assault rifle.  While well-made, it won't hold up as well as factory designs, and isn't standardized to fit common production models.

name: survivor's 12 gauge magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's full auto shotgun.  A well-made simplication of the Saiga 12's variant of the AK pattern, it still won't fit to factory specifications.

name: survivor's 9mm magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's 9mm SMG.  Uses a similiar simplifcation as seen by handmade magazines for the STEN submachine gun, gaining some reliablity at the cost of compatability.

name: survivor's .45 magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's .45 SMG.  A .45 ACP conversion of a further-simplified STEN pattern, it's decently-made but not as reliable as factory-made designs.

name: survivor's .22 magazine
description: A magazine built for the survivor's .22 SMG.  Although well-made, it isn't as reliable as factory designs, and isn't compatible with any production firearm.

name: survivor's .223 ammo belt
description: An ammo belt for the survivor's .223 LMG, using canvas and steel wire to form non-disintegrating links.  Not as reliable as factory-made ammunition belts, and more awkward to reload too.

name: survivor's 7.62x39 ammo belt
description: An ammo belt for the survivor's 7.62x39 LMG, using canvas and steel wire to form non-disintegrating links.  Not as reliable as factory-made ammunition belts, and more awkward to reload too.

name: survivor's .308 ammo belt
description: An ammo belt for the survivor's .308 LMG, using canvas and steel wire to form non-disintegrating links.  Not as reliable as factory-made ammunition belts, and more awkward to reload too.
